definition: anecdote/lost or apocryphal story about famous person
variant of 軼事遺聞|轶事遗闻[yi4 shi4 yi2 wen2]

sentences.english: The problem here is that reports of its efficacy are mainly anecdotal .
sentences.chinese: 这里的问题是它的有效报道主要是逸事。

sentences.english: Other oddities leak out from the books and the memoirs.
sentences.chinese: 还有一些奇闻逸事从书本和回忆录中泄露出来。

sentences.english: Granddad fetched up some anecdotes of the old days.
sentences.chinese: 老爷爷回忆起旧时的一些逸事。

sentences.english: Mr Ramo’s book is full of engaging vignettes like this.
sentences.chinese: 蓝默先生的新书博引旁征这番引人入胜的奇闻逸事。

sentences.english: The papers are full of stories about the royals.
sentences.chinese: 报纸上尽是些关于王室成员趣闻逸事的报道。

definition: poetic occasion/elegant situation/in literature, the cue for a poem
variant of 軼聞|轶闻[yi4 wen2]
sth else/a separate matter/not the same thing/with different jobs (not colleagues)/a remarkable thing/sth special/an odd thing/sth strange or incomprehensible
various notes or records/a miscellany/scattered jottings
what one has seen and heard/knowledge/one's experience
to talk of the past and discuss the present (idiom)/to chat freely/to discuss everything
classical story or quote from the literature/the story behind sth
